events.title: Battle of Shiloh Begins
events.description: The Battle of Shiloh, one of the major early engagements of the American Civil War, started in southwestern Tennessee.
events.significance: Marked one of the bloodiest battles in the Civil War, demonstrating the war's increasing brutality and high casualties.

events.title: Founding of the World Health Organization (WHO)
events.description: The World Health Organization officially came into existence as a specialized agency of the United Nations focused on international public health.
events.significance: Established a global authority on health issues, leading international efforts in disease control and health promotion.

events.title: First Official Television Broadcast
events.description: BBC made the world's first official public television broadcast, demonstrating early television technology in London.
events.significance: Marked a major milestone in broadcast media, paving the way for modern television communication.

events.title: The Internet's 'Birthday' - ARPANET First Message
events.description: The first message was sent over the ARPANET, the precursor to the modern internet, between UCLA and Stanford Research Institute.
events.significance: Represented the dawn of the internet, revolutionizing communication and information sharing worldwide.
